results.title: Beyond 2000 Climate in Crisis
results.brief_description: The Greenhouse Effect is the greatest environmental issue to hit the world this century. Its ultimate consequences could be second only to a nuclear war. Created by the Beyond 2000 group, “Climate in Crisis” comprises six segments. In this special report the phenomenon, the Greenhouse Effect, is examined from a global perspective featuring both British and Australian correspondents. Rated: G

results.title: Best of British
results.brief_description: This 8 part series looks at some of the classic cars that have been produced in Great Britain, and have brought years of driving pleasure to fine automobile enthusiasts.

results.title: Best of British: Land Rover
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cox and Synchro Sports Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
This documentary traces the history of the Land Rover through prototypes and production models. The program travels to the locations where Land Rover made its name as a rugged off-road vehicle such as the Andes of South America and the jungles of Belize, and visits the largest Land Rover rally in the world.

results.title: Beware, beware, my beauty fair
results.creator_credit: Jean Lafleur, Peter Svatek, Michael Rubbo and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shows an audience watching, on a school auditorium stage, the portrayal of the beauty and the beast adventure. Behind the scenes, another drama develops as a play within a play is enacted.

results.title: Best of British: Jaguar
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cox and Synchro Sports Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
An early Jaguar advertising slogan summed up the timeless appeal of this great British marque as ‘grace, space and pace’. This documentary explores these legendary qualities by taking a close look at all the significant Jaguar models, from the pre-war coach-built ‘special saloons’ through the SS100 and XK120, the E-type and XJ models, up to Britain’s first ‘supercar’- the XJ220. Interviews with Jaguar drivers such as Stirling Moss and Jack Fairman, and archival footage contribute to a fascinating review of Jaguar’s unique place in British motoring history.

results.title: Better living through circuitry [DVD]
results.brief_description: Although directed by John Reiss,Better Living Through Circuitry’ is a collaborative documentary exploring the evolution of theRave’ counter-culture with particular focus on the American scene. It explores the technological and musical evolutions with artists, Kraftwerk,Genesis p. Orridge, Carl Cox, the Crystal Method and also more contemporary experimentalists like Scanner. The D>I>Y sampling techniques have recreated the means and understanding of musical perception. Very much a postmodern exploration,yet the psychedelic focus still somewhat reminiscent of thehippie’ revolution of the late 60’s. BLTC explores how raves and warehouse parties ascribe to letting go of inhibitions,social mores and prejudices of mainstream society. They exist as a communally creative release allowing individualism and the celebration of altered states. The film draws parallels with ancient tribal and ritualistic gatherings. Using flash photic light and patterned low wave pulse frequencies,the trance state generates a metabolic connection in the Beta Brain State. More than anything,Better Living Through Circuitry’ is an announcement to the world that tribal rituals and spirituality are alive and well in an age of technological dominance.

results.title: Best of British: Bentley
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cox and Synchro Sports Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
In the twenties Bentley sports cars built up an enviable reputation for speed and reliability, with wins at Brooklands and record-breaking success at Le Mans. More than 75 years after its conception in 1919 Bentley’s original reputation for quality engineering and ‘luxury with sporting character’ is still intact. Using extensive archival footage, the program documents the early designs of W.O Bentley, the Bower Bentley’s and the Bentley 6. Also featured are interviews with Bentley collectors and a liberally illustrated history of the Bentley’s racing career.

results.title: Best of British: Aston Martin
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cox and Synchro Sports Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
The full story of Aston Martin begins in 1913 and continues through an uninterrupted pedigree of classic cars to the sleek DB7 and awesome V8 Vantage of today. This documentary examines in detail all the significant Aston Martin models from the past eighty years including the Brooklands racers from the 1920’s, the rare 1940 Atom, the ‘David Brown’ sports cars, the V8 models and the latest DB7 ‘supercharged sixes’.

results.title: Best of British: Rolls Royce
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cox and Synchro Sports Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
This documentary on the world’s most prestigious car maker, features all the significant Rolls-Royce models from the earliest Silver Ghost and classic Phantoms to the latest Silver Spirit and Flying Spur. A high percentage of all the Roll-Royces ever made are still in existence. Unique footage from the factory shows how the company applies the tradition and standards of almost 90 years of car manufacture to today’s technology.

results.title: Between us
results.brief_description: ‘Between us’ is prolific Melbourne filmmaker Bill Mousoulis’ 31st film. Shot in an achingly realistic style, the film is about choices - how people from varying backgrounds find themselves holding back from making decisions that can change their lives. Central to the narrative is Rick (Phillip Dean), a washing machine repairman who thinks there’s more to life than what he’s doing. Through him we encounter Monica and Loretta; one a woman whose living her dream as a singer, the other too afraid to defy her boyfriend and join the workforce. Cast also includes Sharon Rider, Juliet Ward and James Cruickshank.
